==Events==
* [[456]] &ndash; [[Remistus]], Roman general (''[[magister militum]]''), is [[Siege|besiege]]d with a [[Goths|Gothic]] force at [[Ravenna]] and later executed in the Palace ''in Classis'', outside the city. 
*[[1111]] &ndash; Highest Galician nobility led by [[Pedro Fróilaz de Traba]] and the bishop [[Diego Gelmírez]] crown [[Alfonso VII of León and Castile|Alfonso VII]] as "[[kingdom of Galicia|King of Galicia]]".
*[[1176]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Myriokephalon]] is fought.
*[[1462]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Świecino]] (also known as the Battle of Żarnowiec) is fought during [[Thirteen Years' War (1454–66)|Thirteen Years' War]].
*[[1577]] &ndash; The [[Peace of Bergerac]] is signed between [[Henry III of France]] and the [[Huguenots]].
*[[1630]] &ndash; The city of [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]] is founded.
*[[1631]] &ndash; Sweden wins a major victory at the [[Battle of Breitenfeld (1631)|Battle of Breitenfeld]] against the [[Holy Roman Empire]] during the [[Thirty Years' War]]. 
*[[1683]] &ndash; [[Antonie van Leeuwenhoek]] writes a letter to the [[Royal Society]] describing "[[animalcule]]s": the first known description of [[protozoa]].
*[[1716]] &ndash; [[Jean Thurel]] enlists in the [[Touraine Regiment]] at the age of 17, the first day of a military career that would span for over 90 years.
*[[1775]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: The [[Invasion of Canada (1775)|Invasion of Canada]] begins with the [[Siege of Fort St. Jean]].
*[[1776]] &ndash; The [[Presidio of San Francisco]] is founded in [[New Spain]].
*[[1778]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Fort Pitt (1778)|Treaty of Fort Pitt]] is signed. It is the first formal treaty between the United States and a [[Native Americans in the United States|Native American]] tribe (the [[Lenape]] or Delaware Indians).
*[[1787]] &ndash; The [[United States Constitution]] is signed in [[Philadelphia]].
*[[1809]] &ndash; Peace between Sweden and Russia in the [[Finnish War]]. The territory to become Finland is ceded to Russia by the [[Treaty of Fredrikshamn]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[Francis Scott Key]] finishes his poem "[[Defence of Fort McHenry]]", later to be the lyrics of "The Star-Spangled Banner".
*[[1849]] &ndash; American [[Abolitionism in the United States|abolitionist]] [[Harriet Tubman]] escapes from [[slavery]].
*[[1859]] &ndash; [[Joshua A. Norton]] declares himself "Emperor Norton I" of the United States.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[George B. McClellan]] halts the northward drive of [[Robert E. Lee]]'s [[Confederate army]] in the single-day [[Battle of Antietam]], the bloodiest day in American military history.
*  1862   &ndash; American Civil War: The [[Allegheny Arsenal]] explosion results in the single largest civilian disaster during the war.
*[[1894]] &ndash; [[Battle of Yalu River (1894)|Battle of Yalu River]], the largest naval engagement of the [[First Sino-Japanese War]]. 
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Philippine–American War]]: [[Filipino people|Filipinos]] under [[Juan Cailles]] defeat [[United States|Americans]] under [[Colonel (United States)|Colonel]] [[Benjamin F. Cheatham]] at [[Mabitac]].
*[[1908]] &ndash; The [[Wright Model A|Wright Flyer]] flown by [[Orville Wright]], with [[Lieutenant]] [[Thomas Selfridge]] as passenger, crashes killing Selfridge. He becomes the first airplane fatality.
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[Andrew Fisher]] becomes [[Prime Minister of Australia]] for the third time.
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Manfred von Richthofen]] ("The Red Baron"), a [[flying ace]] of the German [[Luftwaffe|Luftstreitkräfte]], wins his first aerial combat near [[Cambrai]], France.
*[[1924]] &ndash; The [[Border Defence Corps]] is established in the [[Second Polish Republic]] for the defence of the eastern border against armed [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] raids and local bandits. 
*  1924   &ndash; The [[Church of Central Africa, Presbyterian]] is formed.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Soviet Union]] joins [[Nazi Germany]]'s invasion of Poland during the [[Invasion of Poland (1939)|Polish Defensive War]] of 1939.
*  1939   &ndash; World War II: A German [[U-boat]] [[German submarine U-29 (1936)|''U 29'']] sinks the British aircraft carrier {{HMS|Courageous|50|6}}.
*  1939   &ndash; [[Taisto Mäki]] becomes the first man to run the [[10000 metres|10,000 metres]] in under 30 minutes, in a time of 29:52.6
*[[1940]] &ndash; World War II: Following the [[Nazi Germany|German]] defeat in the [[Battle of Britain]], [[Adolf Hitler|Hitler]] postpones [[Operation Sea Lion]] indefinitely.
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: A decree of the [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] State Committee of Defense, restoring [[Vsevobuch]] in the face of the [[Great Patriotic War]], is issued.
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: The Russian city of [[Bryansk]] is liberated from Germans.
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] Airborne troops parachute into the Netherlands as the "Market" half of [[Operation Market Garden]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; The [[Lehi (group)|Lehi]] (also known as the Stern gang) assassinates Count [[Folke Bernadotte]], who was appointed by the [[United Nations]] to mediate between the Arab nations and [[Israel]].
*  1948   &ndash; The [[Nizam of Hyderabad]] surrenders his sovereignty over the [[Hyderabad State]] and joins the [[Indian Union]].
*[[1949]] &ndash; The Canadian steamship {{SS|Noronic}} burns in [[Toronto Harbour]] with the loss of over 118 lives.
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Malaysia]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; The world's first retractable-dome stadium, the [[Civic Arena (Pittsburgh)|Civic Arena]], opens in [[Pittsburgh]], [[Pennsylvania]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Bangladesh]], [[Grenada]] and [[Guinea-Bissau]] join the [[United Nations]].
*[[1976]] &ndash; The first [[Space Shuttle]], [[Space Shuttle Enterprise|Enterprise]], is unveiled by [[NASA]]. 
*[[1978]] &ndash; The [[Camp David Accords (1978)|Camp David Accords]] are signed by [[Israel]] and [[Egypt]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; After weeks of strikes at the [[Lenin Shipyard]] in [[Gdańsk]], Poland, the nationwide independent trade union [[Solidarity (Polish trade union)|Solidarity]] is established. 
*  1980   &ndash; Former [[Nicaraguan]] President [[Anastasio Somoza Debayle]] is killed in [[Asunción]], [[Paraguay]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Vanessa L. Williams|Vanessa Williams]] becomes the first black [[Miss America]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Pope John Paul II]] embraces an AIDS-infected boy while visiting [[San Francisco]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Estonia]], [[North Korea]], [[South Korea]], [[Latvia]], [[Lithuania]], the [[Marshall Islands]] and [[Federated States of Micronesia|Micronesia]] join the [[United Nations]].
*  1991   &ndash; The first version of the [[Linux]] kernel (0.01) is released to the [[Internet]].
*[[1992]] &ndash; An [[Iranian Kurdistan|Iranian Kurdish]] leader and his two joiners are [[Mykonos restaurant assassinations|assassinated by political militants]] in [[Berlin|Berlin, Germany]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; The [[New York Stock Exchange]] reopens for trading after the [[September 11 attacks]], the longest closure since the [[Great Depression]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Fourpeaked Mountain]] in Alaska erupts, marking the first eruption for the long-dormant volcano in at least 10,000 years. 
*  2006   &ndash; An audio tape of [[Ferenc Gyurcsány's speech in Balatonőszöd in May 2006|a private speech]] by Hungarian Prime Minister [[Ferenc Gyurcsány]] is leaked to the public, in which he confessed that his [[Hungarian Socialist Party]] had lied to win the [[Hungarian parliamentary election, 2006|2006 election]], sparking [[2006 protests in Hungary|widespread protests]] across the country.
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[Occupy Wall Street]] movement begins in [[Zuccotti Park]], New York City.
